title: Where is VoIP technology heading? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s heading to the cloud. Actually it’s already there. There’s a small percentage of organizations (roughly 10%) that have adopted cloud based VoIP solutions. Which means the other 90% of premise based users worldwide will be migrating their VoIP environments to the cloud over the next few decades. If you’ve experienced any other Software as a Service offering, you already understand how useful it is. Having the ability to access that app regardless of where you’re at. The same has happened with VoIP which is apart of Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS). In addition to having VoIP, UCaaS provides access to more communication tools like chat, video, meetings and messaging. One of the biggest benefits is being relieved from maintenance, responsibility and support of premise equipment and PSTN connectivity. Just like most organizations don’t manage their own dedicated email servers, the same will happen with VoIP systems. Pay close attention to this movement. I know I am and it’s pretty exciting to see what changes are taking place. That’s where VoIP is heading.

I think it’s headed to : more adoption by peopleBeing used instead of GSM and Fixed lines completely just a small sim for data is all you needInclude video, audio, Messaging out of the boxBecome more API based than having to have your own servers and switchesBecoming more Free where profit comes in value added services and ads
